title: Engineering Thinking and Community-Linked Project: Active Learning and Soft Skills Integration Course for K-12

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational engineering concepts and experience in analyzing social issues
context.additional_context: Blended (online/offline) learning with digital devices, involving community-collaborated real-world problem-solving projects.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze community problems from an engineering perspective and propose solutions.
Learners enhance soft skills such as collaboration and communication through service-learning.

Learners must analyze three or more customer complaint cases in public service settings, submit a sustainable service design proposal integrating technical solutions (e.g., chatbots) and social needs (e.g., accessibility improvements) within two weeks, and score 70+ points on an evaluation rubric (creativity 30%, feasibility 30%, social impact 40%).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
